alert.note: Alert for Chowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:28AM EST until December 18 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Chowan County in northeastern North Carolina... * Until 330 AM EST. * At 1228 AM EST, the public reported flash flooding in Edenton. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ryland, Valhalla, Tyner, Cape Colony, Mavaton, Cisco, Hancock, Center Hill, Macedonia, Smalls Crossroads, Icaria, Saint Johns, Gliden and Sign Pine. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
